name: Chartered Institute of Arbitrators
goal:
CIArb is a leading professional membership body for alternative dispute resolution (ADR) in all its forms. It represents 16,000 ADR professionals globally and is mandated by its Royal Charter to promote its Golden Thread:

• To deliver education, training and qualifications
• To develop the learned society
• Facilitate ADR

As a not-for-profit, UK registered charity and Royal Chartered Institute; CIArb works for the public benefit through an international network of 39 branches. Its 15,000 professionally qualified members are active in over 140 countries.

CIArb's proactive policy and public affairs programme supports the promotion, facilitation, and development of all forms of private dispute resolution through the dissemination of information and providing a platform for ADR practitioners to share their expertise.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Enlargement, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Trade
